text:
Dezika to challenge unsung heroes of meetings industry  
A Global Alliance has been launched delivering support to independent meeting professionals.Dezika’s mission is to raise its members’ service levels to that of a large organization and boost their recognition across the industry, while enabling them to retain their all-important independence and individuality.
 
The range of member benefits Dezika provides will help independent meeting professionals to streamline their operations, scale up through collaboration and skill development, raise their industry profile and deliver higher quality services. Some benefits included:
Industry recognition through Gold, Silver and Bronze membership levels to indicate the value for their individual business
Commission collections
Electronic and forensic audits
Networking events
The ability to scale up by, for example, procuring ancillary services, such as registration and room block and reservation management, through Dezika’s member/partner network
Access to cruise and air group experts
 
Dezika has also become the first global partner of the meetings industry social network I-meet. The agreement allows Dezika members to earn rewards for sharing their experiences online as part of I-meet’s I’ve Been There program.
 
Independent meeting professionals are something of an unknown quantity within the industry, and Dezika will use commission collection data and other intelligence to champion them and prove their significant contribution, giving them the recognition they deserve.
 
“Independent meeting professionals – you are no longer alone,” said Dezika CEO Ian Quartermaine. “The combination of Dezika’s world class offering, along with I-meet’s I’ve Been There initiative, will provide valuable insight into independent planner’s depth of knowledge and business acumen. This will drive more customers, while also building recognition among suppliers of the critical value our members add to the industry.”
